abstract.text: Store, read, share, and synchronize complex data in an Automerge document.

inlineContent.text: The central data type of Automerge is a
which presents a data model similar to a JSON document.
The structure is composed of arrays and string keyed maps, nested within one another.
Unlike JSON, a
is backed by a set of nested CRDTs.
Because of this, a
can be merged with any other
in a manner which preserves user intent as much as possible.
Any type that supports the
protocol can be stored and retrieved from a Document using the
and
This encoder and decoder pair do the work to establish schema within your
, as well as store and load the content into your
types.
For example, you can create a new Automerge document, and an encoder to write into that document:
A new document is empty, containing no data or schema.
When you encode into the document, the default behavior of the encoder establishes the document model.
If the document already has a document model encoded within it, and it doesn’t match the type you encode or decode, the encoder or decoder throws an error.
The following example creates a simple struct and encodes it into a new document:

code: notes: "An example string to show encoding."
// Note(created: 2023-08-01 23:28:38 +0000, notes: "An example string to show encoding.")

that allows you to decode from an Automerge document:

inlineContent.text: The
class provides low-level methods to read and write values into an Automerge document.
The data within an Automerge document is composed of objects, represented by the enumeration
Objects that contain other objects are composed of an identifier:
, and the type:
Like JSON, Automerge includes objects that contain other objects: arrays (
) and dictionaries (
Also like JSON, dictionaries in Automerge are keyed only by Strings.
Automerge goes further than JSON in representing a few types.
For example, Automerge includes a special type
to represent a concurrently editable string, separate from a singular value update of a string, represented by
The
object type represents the value of the string as a list of UTF-8 characters.
This special type encodes and decodes from the type
When serialized by
or
, the type
represents an
object, and handles updates into the Automerge document.
Objects within an Automerge document that don’t contain other objects are made up of the primitive types for Automerge, represented by the enumeration
Automerge maintains more type tracking than JSON, representing a number of different types internally.
The
and
convert existing Swift types into and out of Automerge primitives.

scalar values are a buffer of bytes, represented in Swift by
is a specific date/time location.
The
representation uses an
value to represent the number of seconds since epoch (UTC midnight, Jan 1, 1970).
When using
or
, these values are converted into the type
Be aware that Swift’s Date implementation represents timestamps as
, so there is some less of value (sub-second) when writing into Automerge and reading a value back out.
Be aware that Date values may not be exactly equatable because of this difference.
is another Automerge-specific primitive type that represents a concurrently updated counter.
To update a counter directly within an Automerge document, use the
or
methods.
You can explicitly set a counter value, such as an initial value, using
or
, but using these methods ignores any previously made increments or decrements.
When serialized by
or
, the type
represents a counter value.
When you use the
or
these follow the rules and conventions for Swift types.
For example, an Automerge document with a list of mixed Integers and Strings would not be decodable by
, although it is a valid Automerge document.
It’s important to note that Automerge is a cross platform library, and an Automerge document’s internal schema is dynamic.
Although not supported by Swift arrays, an Automerge array can contain any other kind of Automerge object or primitive within it.
Likewise dictionaries values can contain any other kind of Automerge object or primitive within it.
When you merge another Automerge document, apply updates from an Automerge, or sync with another document, those updates can change the types of values anywhere within the Automerge document.
This can potentially make the document invalid for Swift types you define and retrieve when you use

content.text: Creating, Reading and Writing a document

inlineContent.text: If you’re not using the encoder and decoder, you need to establish container objects yourself, and add and remove values within them.
The methods are
that support this require that you identify the relevant property for an object.
This is either the parameter
, represented by a
, in the case of dictionaries, or the parameter
, represented by
For example, use
to get a value out of a dictionary and
to get a value out of an array.
Methods that insert an object into the document are separate to those which insert primitive values. For example,
puts a value into a dictionary, while
puts an object of the type you specify into the dictionary.
The methods which insert an object return an
of the newly created object, which you use to modify the contents of the new object.
See the documentation for
for more detail on the individual methods.
An Automerge document can be saved using
This will produce a compressed encoding of the document which is extremely efficient and which can be loaded using
Automerge is intentionally agnostic to how you transfer, store, or load the bytes that make up an Automerge document, or updates between documents.

abstract.text: Create, Update, and Synchronize data for collaborative applications.
Building a CLI address book application using Automerge.
A decoder that initializes codable-conforming types from an Automerge document.
An encoder that stores types that conform to the codable protocol into an Automerge document.
A reference to a Text object within an Automerge document.
A type that represents the value of an Automerge counter.
An Automerge document that provides an interface to the document-structured data it contains.
Get the value at the index position you provide from the array object you specify.
Get the value of the key you provide from the dictionary object you specify.
Increment or decrement a counter refrerenced at the index you provide in the array object you specify.
Increment or decrement the counter referenced by the key you provide in the dictionary object you specify.
Creates a new document from the data that you provide.
Set or update a value within an array object you specify.
Set or update a value within a dictionary object you specify.
Set or update an object within a dictionary object you specify.
Encode the Automerge document in a compressed binary format.
The unique internal identifier for an object stored in an Automerge document.
A type that represents an Automerge object.
A type that represents an array of Automerge values.
A type that represents a dictionary that uses the type String for keys.
A type that represents an array of unicode characters.
A type that represents a primitive Automerge value.
A Boolean value.
A byte buffer.
An integer counter.
A floating point number.
A signed integer.
A null.
A string.
A timestamp represented by the number of seconds since UNIX epoch (Jan 1st, 1970, 00:00 UTC).
An unsigned integer.
A type that represents a value or object managed by Automerge.
